analyzed: ches grangs med pa na /

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

analyzed: gcig tu sangs rgyas yid la byed /

analyzed: chos yid la byed /

original: dge 'dun yid la byed do //
analyzed: dge 'dun yid la byed do //

original: kye skyes bu dam pa dag /

original: skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa rnams las yongs su thar bar 'gyur ba thob nas phyi ma'i tshe phyi ma'i dus na 'dzam bu'i gling 'di na sems can gang dag par mi 'dzin pa dang /

original: med pa lnga byed pa dang / bram ze gsod pa dang / ba lang gsod pa dang / chom rkun byed pa dang / g-yon can dang / sho gam sgrags pa dang / brdzun du smra ba dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par spyod pa dang /

analyzed: bshes pa la 'khu ba dang / sngon gyi las kyi sgrib pas zin pa dag 'byung bar 'gyur te /

analyzed: de dag thams cad gzungs 'di'i mthus / thos pa tsam mam /

original: bklags pa tsam mam /
analyzed: bklags pa tsam mam /

analyzed: kun chub par byas pa 'am /

analyzed: lus la thogs sam /

analyzed: bris nas 'chang ngam /

analyzed: rgyal mtshan gyi rtse mo la 'dogs sam /

analyzed: rva ba la bris pa 'am /

analyzed: chung du na sgra nyan pa 'am /

original: kla klo'i 'jigs pas ma yin /
analyzed: kla klo'i 'jigs pas ma yin /

original: la ma dang / lam gol ba'i 'jigs pas ma yin /

analyzed: gnod sbyin gyi 'jigs pas ma yin /

analyzed: sbrul gyis 'jigs pa mi 'byung /

original: lus la rims kyis mi tshugs te /🔽zhag gcig pa 'am /

analyzed: zhag @451a *// gnyis pa 'am /

analyzed: zhag gsum pa 'am /

analyzed: zhag bzhi pa 'am /

analyzed: rtag pa'i ri mas sam /

analyzed: rims thams cad kyis lus la mi tshugs par 'gyur /

original: mig gi nad mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: mig gi nad mi 'byung ste /

analyzed: so'i nad ma yin / mchu'i nad ma yin /
translated: No one will have tooth diseases.🔽No one will have lip diseases.

original: mgrin pa'i nad ma yin /
analyzed: mgrin pa'i nad ma yin /

original: rna par zug pa ma yin /
analyzed: rna par zug pa ma yin /

analyzed: 'khru pa'i nad ma yin /

original: shu ba'i nad ma yin /
analyzed: shu ba'i nad ma yin /

original: brla'i nad ma yin /🔽byin pa'i nad ma yin /
analyzed: brla'i nad ma yin / byin pa'i nad ma yin /

analyzed: rkang pa'i nad ma yin /

original: gzhogs phyed na ba ma yin /
analyzed: gzhogs phyed na ba ma yin /

original: long bar mi 'gyur /🔽zhar bar ma yin /
analyzed: long bar mi 'gyur / zhar bar ma yin /
translated: He will not be blind.🔽He will not be one-eyed.

original: sgur po ma yin /
analyzed: sgur po ma yin /

analyzed: pha rol gyi mthus 'chi bar mi 'gyur / 'on par mi 'gyur / sha bkra can du mi 'gyur /

original: brnyas shing gnas par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: brnyas shing gnas par mi 'gyur te /

analyzed: yon tan gyi khyad par 'di dag chos dang ldan par 'byung bar 'gyur ro // 'chi ba'i tshe na yang spobs pa mi zad par 'gyur /

original: sems @451b 'khrugs pas dus byed par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: sems @451b 'khrugs pas dus byed par mi 'gyur /

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad zhal mngon du bstan nas dbugs 'byin pa mdzad par 'gyur /🔽lus la byad dang / g-yengs byed kyis mi tshugs /

analyzed: lus la sngags kyi sbyor bas mi tshugs / bde bar gnyid kyis log par 'gyur /

original: bde bar sad par 'gyur /
analyzed: bde bar sad par 'gyur /

original: rmi lam na yang sangs rgyas brgya stong mthong bar 'gyur /
analyzed: rmi lam na yang sangs rgyas brgya stong mthong bar 'gyur /

original: de bzhin gshegs pa byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs kyis bskor ba thams cad mthong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs kyis bskor ba thams cad mthong bar 'gyur te /

analyzed: gsang ba'i gzungs kyi mthus yon tan gyi khyad par de lta bu 'byung ngo zhes smra ba mthong ngo //
translated: Through the power of this secret dhāraṇī, such special qualities will arise.”

original: de nas drang srong de rnams chos kyi dga' ba snying la reg cing spro ba thob nas /
analyzed: de nas drang srong de rnams chos kyi dga' ba snying la reg cing spro ba thob nas /
translated: Then those sages, their hearts touched by the joy of the Dharma, were delighted.

analyzed: mar gsar gyi gong bu bzhu ba bzhin du lus zhig nas zhu ba'i khu ba de sa'i nang du thim mo //

analyzed: de nas sa gzhi de las smyug ma'i mde'u gser gyi kha dog can /
translated: Then, from the ground, three golden bamboo shoots grew.

original: rtsa ba rin po che sna bdun las byas pa /
analyzed: rtsa ba rin po che sna bdun las byas pa /

original: lo ma gser las byas pa /
analyzed: lo ma gser las byas pa /

analyzed: rtse mo mu tig las byas pa /

original: bkra ba / blta na sdug pa /
analyzed: bkra ba / blta na sdug pa /

original: stobs dang ldan pa /
analyzed: stobs dang ldan pa /

original: gzi brjid dang ldan pa /
analyzed: gzi brjid dang ldan pa /

original: dri zhim pa /
analyzed: dri zhim pa /

analyzed: shin tu yid du 'ong ba gsum skyes so //

analyzed: smyug ma'i mde'u de rnams zla ba bcu lon pa dang gas te /

analyzed: de rnams kyi dbus nas khye'u gzugs bzang po /
translated: From their centers emerged three boys who were well proportioned,

original: mdzes pa / blta na sdug pa /
analyzed: mdzes pa / blta na sdug pa /

original: kha dog rgyas pa /
analyzed: kha dog rgyas pa /

original: mchog dang @452a *//
analyzed: mchog dang @452a *//
translated: were supreme,

original: ldan pa gsum byung ngo //
analyzed: ldan pa gsum byung ngo //

analyzed: ji tsam du zhag bdun lon pa'i nyin mo byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /

analyzed: 'od 'dom gang gis kun nas spras par gyur to //

analyzed: smyug ma'i mde'u de rnams kyang khang pa brtsegs mar gyur to //

analyzed: rgyal po chen po bzhi yang steng na gdugs 'dzin cing me tog gis gtor te /

analyzed: 'jig rten du sangs rgyas byung ngo zhes dbyangs su sgrog cing /🔽'di lta ste /

analyzed: gnod sbyin gyi bdag po rgyal po chen po nor bu'i rdo rje zhes bya ba 'khor gnod sbyin brgya stong phrag du ma dag bcom ldan 'das de dag la mchod pa byed do //
translated: and the yakṣa lord Mahārāja called Maṇivara, together with their retinues of many hundreds of thousands of yakṣas, made offerings to those blessed ones.

analyzed: sa phyogs de yang rin po che sna bdun gyi @452b rang bzhin du gyur to //

analyzed: me tog gi shing thams cad kyang rin po che'i rang bzhin du gyur to //

original: lag na rdo rje /
analyzed: lag na rdo rje /

original: de'i tshe de'i dus kyi tshe /
analyzed: de'i tshe de'i dus kyi tshe /
translated: at that time,

analyzed: sa phyogs kyang 'di yin no //

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor 'dus pa yang 'di yin no //

analyzed: de rnams drang srong du gyur pa na gzungs 'di thos pa tsam mam /
translated: When they were ṛṣis, they attained perfect buddhahood in awakening merely by hearing this dhāraṇī

analyzed: snying po sems la bsgoms pa tsam gyis drang srong gi lus spangs nas / byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //

original: lag na rdo rje /
analyzed: lag na rdo rje /
translated: Vajrapāṇi,

analyzed: de ltar mi lta'o //
translated: do not see it in that way.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: nga nyid de'i tshe de'i dus na gnas gtsang ma'i ris kyi lhar gyur to //

analyzed: lag na rdo rje / de'i tshe de'i dus na gnas gtsang ma zhes bya ba gang gis drang srong de rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa @453a *//

analyzed: de rnams la bkur sti dang / rim gro byas pa gang yin pa de gzhan zhig yin snyam na de ltar mi blta'o //
translated: was someone else, do not see it in that way.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: de nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag thams cad kyis /

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa sh'akya thub pa la legs so zhes bya ba byin to //

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba /

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi snying por gshegs pa'i gsang ba /

original: de bzhin @453b gshegs pa thams cad kyi rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul gyi gsang ba /
analyzed: de bzhin @453b gshegs pa thams cad kyi rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul gyi gsang ba /

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs pa'i gsang ba /

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i dgongs pa'i gsang ba /

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rig pa'i gnas kyi gsang ba; de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dkyil 'khor gyi gsang ba /

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi phyag rgya yang dag par 'dzin pa'i gsang ba /

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi 'od zer bye ba rab tu 'gyed pa'i gsang ba /

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi yang dag pa'i mtha'i gsang ba /
translated: the secret of the limit of reality of all the tathāgatas,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi rnam par 'phrul pa'i byin gyi brlabs kyi gsang ba /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi rnam par 'phrul pa'i byin gyi brlabs kyi gsang ba /
translated: the secret of the blessing of the emanations of the samādhi of all the tathāgatas,

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi byang chub sems dpa'i byang chub kyi sems kyi rgyan gyi gsang ba /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad sangs rgyas kyi sa thams cad la rab tu 'god pa'i gsang ba /

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ting nge 'dzin rtogs par thugs su chud pa'i gsang ba /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ting nge 'dzin rtogs par thugs su chud pa'i gsang ba /
translated: the secret of the realization of the samādhi of all the tathāgatas,

original: sgrib pa thams cad 'jig par byed pa'i gsang ba 'di gsungs pa legs so //
analyzed: sgrib pa thams cad 'jig par byed pa'i gsang ba 'di gsungs pa legs so //
translated: and the secret of the destruction of all obscurations.

original: legs so // de nas de @454a *//
analyzed: legs so // de nas de @454a *//
translated: Then, the bodhisattva mahāsattva Vajrapāṇi,

original: bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pas dgongs pa dang ldan zhing mkhyen bzhin du /
analyzed: bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pas dgongs pa dang ldan zhing mkhyen bzhin du /

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la gzigs nas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la gzigs nas /
translated: having seen all the Tathāgatas,

original: 'od zer kha dog sna tshogs bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong /
analyzed: 'od zer kha dog sna tshogs bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong /
translated: emitted many quintillions of light rays of various colors,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: namely

original: sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po dang / le brgan dang / shel dang / dngul gyi mdog dag bkye ste /
analyzed: sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po dang / le brgan dang / shel dang / dngul gyi mdog dag bkye ste /
translated: blue, yellow, red, white, purple, crystal, and silver.

original: de rnams 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas mu med pa rnams su dong nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad snang bar byas te /
analyzed: de rnams 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas mu med pa rnams su dong nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad snang bar byas te /
translated: Those light rays went to infinite and limitless world systems, illuminating all the buddha realms.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad bskul nas slar log ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad bskul nas slar log ste /
translated: Having invoked all the Tathāgatas, they returned

original: bcom ldan 'das la lan gsum bskor ba byas nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la lan gsum bskor ba byas nas /
translated: and circumambulated the Blessed One three times.

original: dbu'i gtsug tor gyi gseb tu bzhugs so //
analyzed: dbu'i gtsug tor gyi gseb tu bzhugs so //
translated: They then entered into the crown of his head.

original: 'od zer de dag zhugs ma thag tu bcom ldan 'das kyis tshangs pa'i gsung dbyangs chen pos bkang nas /
analyzed: 'od zer de dag zhugs ma thag tu bcom ldan 'das kyis tshangs pa'i gsung dbyangs chen pos bkang nas /
translated: As soon as the light rays enter, the Bhagavat fills them with the great melodious voice of Brahma.

original: rig sngags chen po 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: rig sngags chen po 'di gsungs so //
translated: As soon as the light rays entered, the Blessed One filled the sky with the great Brahma voice and spoke this great awareness mantra:

original: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta ma ni sha ta d'ipta /
analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta ma ni sha ta d'ipta /
translated: Oṃ sarva tathāgata maṇi śata dīpa

original: dzva la dzva la /
analyzed: dzva la dzva la /
translated: jvala jvala

original: dharma dh'a tu garbhe /
analyzed: dharma dh'a tu garbhe /
translated: dharmadhātu garbha

original: ma ni ma ni mh'a ma ni ta th'a ga ta hri da ya ma ni sv'a h'a /
analyzed: ma ni ma ni mh'a ma ni ta th'a ga ta hri da ya ma ni sv'a h'a /
translated: maṇi maṇi mahā maṇi tathāgata hṛdaya maṇi svāhā

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis rig sngags kyi rgyal mo 'di gsungs ma thag tu ri dang / tshal dang / nags tshal du bcas pa'i sa rnam pa drug tu rab tu g-yos so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis rig sngags kyi rgyal mo 'di gsungs ma thag tu ri dang / tshal dang / nags tshal du bcas pa'i sa rnam pa drug tu rab tu g-yos so //
translated: As soon as the Blessed One spoke this queen of awareness mantras, the earth with its mountains, forests, and jungles shook in six ways.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan @454b 'das thams cad kyis kyang legs so zhes bya ba byin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan @454b 'das thams cad kyis kyang legs so zhes bya ba byin te /
translated: All the blessed buddhas also gave their approval, saying, “Excellent!”

original: sh'akya thub pa /
analyzed: sh'akya thub pa /
translated: “Śākyamuni,

original: khyod kyis mchog tu gsungs pa ni legs par gsungs te /
analyzed: khyod kyis mchog tu gsungs pa ni legs par gsungs te /
translated: what you have taught is excellent.

original: legs so // legs so //
analyzed: legs so // legs so //
translated: Excellent, excellent!”

original: bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa'i las kyi phyir dza mbu'i chu bo'i gser las byung ba'i sprin chen po nam mkha'i dkyil du chags so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa'i las kyi phyir dza mbu'i chu bo'i gser las byung ba'i sprin chen po nam mkha'i dkyil du chags so //
translated: and a great cloud of Jambu River gold appeared in the sky in order to make offerings to the Bhagavat.

original: phyogs bcu kun tu rin po che sna bdun gyi char bab bo; ;tsandan sbrul gyi snying po'i phye ma'i char yang bab bo //
analyzed: phyogs bcu kun tu rin po che sna bdun gyi char bab bo; ;tsandan sbrul gyi snying po'i phye ma'i char yang bab bo //
translated: A rain of the seven precious gems fell in all ten directions, and a rain of sandalwood powder fell.

original: au dum b'a ra'i me tog gi char yang bab bo //
analyzed: au dum b'a ra'i me tog gi char yang bab bo //
translated: A rain of udumbara flowers fell.

original: bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa'i las kyi phyir /🔽gzhan yang / me tog sna tshogs padma dang / ku mu da dang / padma dkar po dang / dri ngad ldang ba dang / man d'a ra ba dang / mand'a ra ba chen po dang / me tog mdog mdzes pa dang / mdog mdzes pa chen po dang /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa'i las kyi phyir / gzhan yang / me tog sna tshogs padma dang / ku mu da dang / padma dkar po dang / dri ngad ldang ba dang / man d'a ra ba dang / mand'a ra ba chen po dang / me tog mdog mdzes pa dang / mdog mdzes pa chen po dang /
translated: In order to make offerings to the Bhagavat,🔽and also a rain of various flowers: lotuses, kumudas, white lotuses, fragrant flowers, mandārava flowers, great mandārava flowers, beautiful-colored flowers, great beautiful-colored flowers,

original: manydzu sha ka dang / manydzu sha ka chen po dang / yid 'ong ba dang / pa ri sha ka dang / me tog tsam pa ka'i char dag bab po //
analyzed: manydzu sha ka dang / manydzu sha ka chen po dang / yid 'ong ba dang / pa ri sha ka dang / me tog tsam pa ka'i char dag bab po //
translated: māndārava flowers, great māndārava flowers, pleasing flowers, parīṣa flowers, and campaka flowers fell.

original: bdud kyi gnas thams cad rab tu 'bar bar gyur te bdud kyi rigs kyi lha thams cad skrag cing sngangs par gyur to //
analyzed: bdud kyi gnas thams cad rab tu 'bar bar gyur te bdud kyi rigs kyi lha thams cad skrag cing sngangs par gyur to //
translated: All the abodes of Māra became ablaze, and all the gods of the class of Māra became frightened and terrified.

original: bgegs dang / log 'dren thams cad kyi lus rdul cing lus dri mi zhi ma par gyur nas phyogs bcur rab tu 'bros par brtsams so //
analyzed: bgegs dang / log 'dren thams cad kyi lus rdul cing lus dri mi zhi ma par gyur nas phyogs bcur rab tu 'bros par brtsams so //
translated: The bodies of all the obstructors and misleaders became covered in dust, and their bodies became foul-smelling. They began to flee in the ten directions.

original: sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa l mngon par dad pa'i lha gang dag yin pa'i lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / @455a *//
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa l mngon par dad pa'i lha gang dag yin pa'i lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / @455a *//
translated: The gods who had faith in the Buddha’s teaching, the gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras,

original: nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / mi dang / mi ma yin pa dag gis kyang rang rang gi gzhal med khang rnams bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa'i las kyi phyir phul lo //
analyzed: nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / mi dang / mi ma yin pa dag gis kyang rang rang gi gzhal med khang rnams bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa'i las kyi phyir phul lo //
translated: garuḍas, kinnaras, mahoragas, humans, and non-humans offered their own palaces to the Blessed One for the purpose of making offerings.

original: de nas nor bu rab snang sems la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong nor bu dang / rin po che sna tshogs thogs nas bcom ldan 'das gang na ba de logs su mchod pa byed do //
analyzed: de nas nor bu rab snang sems la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong nor bu dang / rin po che sna tshogs thogs nas bcom ldan 'das gang na ba de logs su mchod pa byed do //
translated: Then, the bodhisattvas such as Ratnaprabhāsa, with many trillions of bodhisattvas holding jewels and various precious substances, made offerings to the Bhagavān.

original: de nas lag na rdo rje la sogs pa'i rig sngags 'chang ba bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag du ma ras bcos bu'i gos brgya stong gis bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa byed do //
analyzed: de nas lag na rdo rje la sogs pa'i rig sngags 'chang ba bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag du ma ras bcos bu'i gos brgya stong gis bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa byed do //
translated: Then, many trillions of vidyādhara mantras such as Vajrapāṇi made offerings to the Bhagavān with hundreds of thousands of cotton garments.

original: rgyal po chen po bzhi yang rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha'i bu brgya stong phrag du ma me tog sna tshogs dang / bdug pa dang / dri dang / phreng ba dang / byug pa dang / phye ma dang / chos gos dang / gdugs dang /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po bzhi yang rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha'i bu brgya stong phrag du ma me tog sna tshogs dang / bdug pa dang / dri dang / phreng ba dang / byug pa dang / phye ma dang / chos gos dang / gdugs dang /
translated: The Four Great Kings, with many hundreds of thousands of sons of the gods of the Heaven of the Four Kings, holding various flowers, incense, perfumes, garlands, ointments, powders, Dharma robes, parasols,

original: rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan dag thogs nas bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa byed do //
analyzed: rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan dag thogs nas bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa byed do //
translated: banners, and flags, made offerings to the Bhagavān.

original: tshangs pa la sogs te tshangs ris kyi lha'i bu rnams dang / brgya byin la sogs pa sum cu rtsa gsum gyi ris kyi lha'i bu brgya stong dag kyang bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa'i las la brtson par byed do //
analyzed: tshangs pa la sogs te tshangs ris kyi lha'i bu rnams dang / brgya byin la sogs pa sum cu rtsa gsum gyi ris kyi lha'i bu brgya stong dag kyang bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa'i las la brtson par byed do //
translated: The sons of the gods of the Brahma heaven, such as Brahma, and the sons of the gods of the Thirty-three heaven, such as Indra, with hundreds of thousands, strive to make offerings to the Blessed One.

original: de bzhin du sred med kyi bu dang / dbang phyug chen po dang / nor bu bzang po dang / gang ba bzang po dang / stobs kyi lha la sogs pa yang bcom ldan 'das la mchod @455b pa byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du sred med kyi bu dang / dbang phyug chen po dang / nor bu bzang po dang / gang ba bzang po dang / stobs kyi lha la sogs pa yang bcom ldan 'das la mchod @455b pa byed do //
translated: Likewise, Narayana, Mahesvara, Manibhadra, Purnabhadra, the god of strength, and so forth make offerings to the Blessed One.

original: lha'i bu nyi ma dang / zla ba yang nam mkha'i dkyil nas bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa byed do //
analyzed: lha'i bu nyi ma dang / zla ba yang nam mkha'i dkyil nas bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa byed do //
translated: The sons of the gods Sun and Moon, from the midst of the sky, make offerings to the Blessed One.

original: dpal lha mo chen mo dang / lha mo chen mo dbyangs can ma dang / lha mo chen mo dung can ma dang / gnod sbyin mo chen mo 'phrog ma yang 'khor brgya stong dang / lha mo chen mo 'jigs byed ma dang / rdo rje nag mo dang /
analyzed: dpal lha mo chen mo dang / lha mo chen mo dbyangs can ma dang / lha mo chen mo dung can ma dang / gnod sbyin mo chen mo 'phrog ma yang 'khor brgya stong dang / lha mo chen mo 'jigs byed ma dang / rdo rje nag mo dang /
translated: The great glorious goddess, the great goddess Sarasvati, the great goddess Shankhinī, the great yakshini Hārītī, with hundreds of thousands of retinues, the great goddess Bhairava, Vajra-kṛṣṇa,

original: me tog so dang / lha mo chen mo pho nya mo dag kyang rang rang gi gzhal med khang rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa byed do //
analyzed: me tog so dang / lha mo chen mo pho nya mo dag kyang rang rang gi gzhal med khang rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa byed do //
translated: The great goddesses and messengers, such as Puṣpadantī, also made offerings to the Blessed One with their own palaces.

original: dri za'i ris kyi lha'i bu du ma dag kyang sil snyan yan lag lnga dang ldan pa brgya stong bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa'i las kyi phyir brtson pas dkrol bar byed do //
analyzed: dri za'i ris kyi lha'i bu du ma dag kyang sil snyan yan lag lnga dang ldan pa brgya stong bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa'i las kyi phyir brtson pas dkrol bar byed do //
translated: Many gods from the class of gandharvas, with hundreds of thousands of five-part musical instruments, played them in order to make offerings to the Blessed One.

original: klu'i rgyal po brgya stong phrag du ma 'dus pa /
analyzed: klu'i rgyal po brgya stong phrag du ma 'dus pa /
translated: Many hundreds of thousands of nāga kings gathered,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: namely:

original: klu'i rgyal po rgya mtsho dang / klu'i rgyal po dga' bo dang / nye dga' bo dang / chu lha dang / shin tu rab gnas dang / gtsug na nor bu dang / klu'i rgyal po rnam pa kun nas rdzogs pa'i 'od dag kyang rin po che nor bu skar 'od sna tshogs kyis bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa byed do //
analyzed: klu'i rgyal po rgya mtsho dang / klu'i rgyal po dga' bo dang / nye dga' bo dang / chu lha dang / shin tu rab gnas dang / gtsug na nor bu dang / klu'i rgyal po rnam pa kun nas rdzogs pa'i 'od dag kyang rin po che nor bu skar 'od sna tshogs kyis bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa byed do //
translated: the nāga kings Sāgara, Nanda, Upananda, Varuṇa, Supratiṣṭhita, Śikhī, and the nāga king Samanta­paripūrṇa­prabhā made offerings to the Blessed One with various precious jewels and gems.

original: 'khor chen po yang 'dus par gyur to //
analyzed: 'khor chen po yang 'dus par gyur to //
translated: A great assembly also gathered.

original: 'khor los bsgyur pa'i rgyal po chen po de yang blon po bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag du ma'i 'khor dang / btsun mo'i tshogs kyi 'khor dang bcas shing /
analyzed: 'khor los bsgyur pa'i rgyal po chen po de yang blon po bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag du ma'i 'khor dang / btsun mo'i tshogs kyi 'khor dang bcas shing /
translated: surrounded by a retinue of queens,🔽and surrounded by his thousand sons,

original: bu stong du gcig gis ma tshang bas yongs su bskor te mdun gyis bltas so //
analyzed: bu stong du gcig gis ma tshang bas yongs su bskor te mdun gyis bltas so //
translated: looked out upon them.

original: sa de yang rdo rje'i rang bzhin du gyur to //
analyzed: sa de yang rdo rje'i rang bzhin du gyur to //
translated: That ground became of the nature of vajra.

original: de nas 'khor chen po de nyid kyi dbus bcom @456a *//
analyzed: de nas 'khor chen po de nyid kyi dbus bcom @456a *//
translated: Then, in the middle of that great retinue, in front of the Blessed One,

analyzed: ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar sa la brtol nas rin po che sna bdun gyi padma 'dab ma stong pa zhig byung ste /
translated: the earth split open and a thousand-petaled lotus made of the seven precious substances appeared.

original: padma de'i steng du 'dzam bu chu bo'i gser las byas pa'i 'khor lo rtsibs stong pa /🔽mu khyud dang bcas pa /
analyzed: padma de'i steng du 'dzam bu chu bo'i gser las byas pa'i 'khor lo rtsibs stong pa / mu khyud dang bcas pa /
translated: On top of that lotus appeared a thousand-spoked wheel made of the gold of the Jambū River,🔽with a rim,

original: lte ba dang bcas pa /
analyzed: lte ba dang bcas pa /
translated: with a hub,

original: lhag pa'i 'od 'phro ba nyi ma bzhin du gsal bzhig byung ngo //
analyzed: lhag pa'i 'od 'phro ba nyi ma bzhin du gsal bzhig byung ngo //
translated: and with a surplus of light shining like the sun.

original: de'i 'od kyis stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams snang bar byas nas /
analyzed: de'i 'od kyis stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams snang bar byas nas /
translated: Its light illuminated the trichiliocosm.

original: 'khor lo de'i lte ba'i nang nas sgra byung ba /
analyzed: 'khor lo de'i lte ba'i nang nas sgra byung ba /
translated: From the center of that wheel, a voice came forth:

original: sh'akya thub pa /
analyzed: sh'akya thub pa /
translated: “Śākyamuni!🔽Excellent, excellent!

original: gang 'di 'dra ba'i gzungs kyi gsang ba rnams gsungs pa ni legs so //
analyzed: gang 'di 'dra ba'i gzungs kyi gsang ba rnams gsungs pa ni legs so //
translated: The one who has taught these secret dhāraṇīs,

original: legs so // chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i rig sngags kyi rgyal po /
analyzed: legs so // chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i rig sngags kyi rgyal po /
translated: the king of vidyā mantras that turns the wheel of Dharma,

original: byang chub chen po'i snying por gshegs pa'i rig sngags /
analyzed: byang chub chen po'i snying por gshegs pa'i rig sngags /
translated: the vidyā mantra that has gone to the essence of great awakening,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rig sngags kyi snying po /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rig sngags kyi snying po /
translated: the essence of the vidyā mantras of all tathāgatas,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi yang dag pa'i tshul gyi rig sngags kyi snying po 'di /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi yang dag pa'i tshul gyi rig sngags kyi snying po 'di /
translated: the essence of the vidyā mantras of the tathāgatas’ true way,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: yang  zungs shig /
analyzed: yang  zungs shig /
translated: retain it!

original: nor bu chen po rgyas pa'i gzhal med khang shin tu rab tu gnas pa gsang ba zhes bya bar zungs shig /

translated: No illness will arise in one’s body.

original: mig nad ma yin //🔽sna nad ma yin /
analyzed: mig nad ma yin // sna nad ma yin /
translated: [One will not suffer from] eye disease.🔽[One will not suffer from] nose disease.

original: lce nad ma yin /
analyzed: lce nad ma yin /
translated: [One will not suffer from] tongue disease.

original: rna ba'i nad ma yin /
analyzed: rna ba'i nad ma yin /
translated: [One will not suffer from] ear disease.

original: so nad ma yin /
analyzed: so nad ma yin /
translated: [One will not suffer from] tooth disease.

original: klad nad ma yin /
analyzed: klad nad ma yin /
translated: [One will not suffer from] brain disease.

original: yan lag dang / nying lag gi nad ma yin /
analyzed: yan lag dang / nying lag gi nad ma yin /
translated: nor a disease of the limbs or minor limbs.

original: rims ma yin te /
analyzed: rims ma yin te /
translated: It is not a fever.

original: zhag gcig pa'am /
analyzed: zhag gcig pa'am /
translated: It does not affect the body for one day,

original: zhag gnyis pa'am /
analyzed: zhag gnyis pa'am /
translated: nor for two days,

original: zhag gsum pa'am /
analyzed: zhag gsum pa'am /
translated: nor for three days,

original: zhag bzhi pas lus la tshugs par mi 'gyur ro //🔽sprul gyi 'jigs pas ma yin /
analyzed: zhag bzhi pas lus la tshugs par mi 'gyur ro // sprul gyi 'jigs pas ma yin /
translated: nor for four days.🔽It is not the fear of snakes,

original: gcan gzan khro bo'i 'jigs pas ma yin /
analyzed: gcan gzan khro bo'i 'jigs pas ma yin /
translated: nor the fear of ferocious wild animals.

original: lus la byad kyis tshugs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus la byad kyis tshugs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: No spell can affect the body.

original: gzungs 'di ni yon tan de lta bu dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: gzungs 'di ni yon tan de lta bu dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: This dhāraṇī has such qualities.

original: 'jigs pa thams cad rab tu 'joms par byed pa yin /
analyzed: 'jigs pa thams cad rab tu 'joms par byed pa yin /
translated: It completely destroys all fears,

original: sdig pa thams cad 'jigs par byed pa yin /
analyzed: sdig pa thams cad 'jigs par byed pa yin /
translated: destroys all evil,

original: yon tan thams cad grub par byed pa yin /
analyzed: yon tan thams cad grub par byed pa yin /
translated: accomplishes all good qualities,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par byed pa yin /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par byed pa yin /
translated: and perfects the six perfections.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i de kho na nyid grub par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i de kho na nyid grub par byed pa yin te /
translated: It accomplishes the suchness of the Tathāgata.

original: gzungs 'di ni bklag pas grub pa ste las thams cad byed do //
analyzed: gzungs 'di ni bklag pas grub pa ste las thams cad byed do //
translated: This dhāraṇī is accomplished by recitation and performs all activities.

original: ri khar 'dzegs te bzlas brjod byas na mig gis gang du bltas pa der sems can rnams kyi sdig pa thams cad 'jig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ri khar 'dzegs te bzlas brjod byas na mig gis gang du bltas pa der sems can rnams kyi sdig pa thams cad 'jig par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one recites while standing on a mountain peak, all the sins of sentient beings will be destroyed wherever one looks.

original: sems can dmyal ba thams cad las thar par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba thams cad las thar par 'gyur ro //
translated: All those in the hells will be freed.

original: dud 'gro'i skye gnas su song ba thams cad kyang thar bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dud 'gro'i skye gnas su song ba thams cad kyang thar bar 'gyur ro //
translated: All those who have gone to the animal realm will also be freed.

original: lha khang du zhugs te bzlas brjod byas @459b na lha thams cad des ci bsgo ba bzhin byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lha khang du zhugs te bzlas brjod byas @459b na lha thams cad des ci bsgo ba bzhin byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one recites while entering a temple, all the gods will do whatever one commands.

original: klu'i gnas su zhugs te bzlas brjod byas na klu rnams dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: klu'i gnas su zhugs te bzlas brjod byas na klu rnams dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: If one recites while entering the abode of the nāgas, the nāgas will be subdued.

original: nyi ma la kha bltas te bzlas brjod byas na nyi ma mngon sum du babs nas mdun na 'dug cing mchog ci smra ba de sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: nyi ma la kha bltas te bzlas brjod byas na nyi ma mngon sum du babs nas mdun na 'dug cing mchog ci smra ba de sbyin par byed do //
translated: If one recites while facing the sun, the sun will descend in front of one and will grant whatever boon one requests.

original: lag na rdo rje'i mdun du bzlas brjod byas na mchog thams cad ster cing mthong bar yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lag na rdo rje'i mdun du bzlas brjod byas na mchog thams cad ster cing mthong bar yang 'gyur ro //
translated: If one recites in front of Vajrapāṇi, he will grant all boons and will also be seen.

original: shu dag la sngags stong rtsa brgyad bzlas nas de zos nas rgyal po'i pho brang du zhugs na rgyal po'i btsun mo 'khor dang bcas pa dga' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shu dag la sngags stong rtsa brgyad bzlas nas de zos nas rgyal po'i pho brang du zhugs na rgyal po'i btsun mo 'khor dang bcas pa dga' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one recites the mantra one thousand and eight times over asafoetida and eats it, and then enters the king’s palace, the king’s queen and her retinue will be pleased.

original: ci smras ba de sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: ci smras ba de sbyin par byed do //
translated: Whatever one says, she will grant it.

original: na le sham gyi 'bru la lan bdun bzlas te khar bcug na ci smras pa ster bar byed cing dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: na le sham gyi 'bru la lan bdun bzlas te khar bcug na ci smras pa ster bar byed cing dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: If one puts a myrobalan fruit in one’s mouth, enchanted seven times, whatever one says, she will grant it, and will be enthralled.

original: yungs kar la lan stong rtsa brgyad bzlas te nam mkha' la gtor na rlung dang / ser ba thams cad bkag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yungs kar la lan stong rtsa brgyad bzlas te nam mkha' la gtor na rlung dang / ser ba thams cad bkag par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one scatters mustard seeds enchanted one thousand and eight times into the sky, all winds and hail will be stopped.

original: lan tshva la lan brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas te bram ze rnams la byin na /
analyzed: lan tshva la lan brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas te bram ze rnams la byin na /
translated: If one gives salt, enchanted one hundred and eight times, to brahmins,

original: gang dang / gang gi lan tshva zos pa de dang / de kho na dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang dang / gang gi lan tshva zos pa de dang / de kho na dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: whomever the salt is given to, he will be enthralled.

original: rgyal rigs dbang du bya na /
analyzed: rgyal rigs dbang du bya na /
translated: If one wants to enthrall a kṣatriya,

original: yungs kar gyis sbyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: yungs kar gyis sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: one should offer mustard seeds into the fire.

original: gu gul la sngags stong rtsa brgyad bzlas te gang dang / gang gi gdon la bdugs na de dang / de nyid la 'bab par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gu gul la sngags stong rtsa brgyad bzlas te gang dang / gang gi gdon la bdugs na de dang / de nyid la 'bab par 'gyur ro //
translated: Enchanting gugul one thousand and eight times, if one fumigates with it whatever [deity], it will fall upon that very [deity].

original: bdugs na gdon thams cad las thar bar 'gyur ro //🔽char mi 'bab pa'i tshe klu'i gzugs byas te gnas gru bzhi byas la /
analyzed: bdugs na gdon thams cad las thar bar 'gyur ro // char mi 'bab pa'i tshe klu'i gzugs byas te gnas gru bzhi byas la /
translated: If one fumigates, one will be freed from all grahas.

original: ba @460a *// ser mo'i lci bas klu mgo gsum pa byas la /
analyzed: ba @460a *// ser mo'i lci bas klu mgo gsum pa byas la /
translated: When it does not rain, one should make a square dwelling for the nāgas, and make a three-headed nāga with yellow cow dung.

original: snying gar gser gyis glan par bya'o //
analyzed: snying gar gser gyis glan par bya'o //
translated: One should anoint the heart with gold.

original: lus ni li khris byug par bya'o //🔽gnas kyi gzhi ni sngon pos bsku bar bya'o //
analyzed: lus ni li khris byug par bya'o // gnas kyi gzhi ni sngon pos bsku bar bya'o //
translated: The body should be anointed with vermillion.🔽The dwelling place should be anointed with blue.

original: gnas gru bzhi ni shing pa la sha ltar kha dog sngon por bya'o //🔽bum pa gang ba bzhi bzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: gnas gru bzhi ni shing pa la sha ltar kha dog sngon por bya'o // bum pa gang ba bzhi bzhag par bya'o //
translated: The square dwelling should be made blue like a palasha tree.🔽Four full vases should be placed.

original: pog phor bzhi bzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: pog phor bzhi bzhag par bya'o //
translated: Four incense burners should be placed.

original: bum pa bzhi bzhag par bya ste /🔽gcig ni 'o ma /🔽gcig ni zho /
analyzed: bum pa bzhi bzhag par bya ste / gcig ni 'o ma / gcig ni zho /
translated: Four vases should be placed:🔽one with milk,🔽one with curd,

original: gcig ni 'o thug /
analyzed: gcig ni 'o thug /
translated: one with milk porridge,

original: gcig ni zhun mar bu ram can no //
analyzed: gcig ni zhun mar bu ram can no //
translated: and one with clarified butter and molasses.

original: ba'i lci bas gling bzhi pa'i dkyil 'khor bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: ba'i lci bas gling bzhi pa'i dkyil 'khor bri bar bya'o //
translated: One should draw the maṇḍala of the four continents with cow dung.

original: grva bzhi ru phyes padma bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: grva bzhi ru phyes padma bri bar bya'o //
translated: One should draw lotuses in the four corners.

original: mda' bzhi btsugs la tshon skud sna lngas bskor bar bya'o //
analyzed: mda' bzhi btsugs la tshon skud sna lngas bskor bar bya'o //
translated: One should plant four arrows and surround it with five-colored strings.

original: tshon sna lnga'i ba dan gdags par bya'o //
analyzed: tshon sna lnga'i ba dan gdags par bya'o //
translated: One should hang banners of five colors.

original: bdug pa sna bzhi po gu gul dang / lce phog dang / tsandan dang / du ru ska bsreg par bya'o //
analyzed: bdug pa sna bzhi po gu gul dang / lce phog dang / tsandan dang / du ru ska bsreg par bya'o //
translated: One should burn the four types of incense: agalloch, tongue-leaf, sandalwood, and durvā grass.

original: sa bon bdun gtor bar bya'o //
analyzed: sa bon bdun gtor bar bya'o //
translated: One should scatter the seven seeds.

original: kha dog lnga'i gtor ma gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: kha dog lnga'i gtor ma gzhag par bya'o //
translated: One should place the five-colored bali.

original: 'bras bu dang / me tog gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang / me tog gzhag par bya'o //
translated: One should place fruits and flowers.

original: rig pa 'dzin pas kha shar phyogs su bltas te 'dug nas rig sngags stong rtsa brgyad bzlas te yungs kar re re nas spyi bor brdeg par bya'o //
analyzed: rig pa 'dzin pas kha shar phyogs su bltas te 'dug nas rig sngags stong rtsa brgyad bzlas te yungs kar re re nas spyi bor brdeg par bya'o //
translated: The vidyādhara, facing east, should recite the vidyā eight thousand times and strike the head with white mustard seeds one by one.

original: stong rtsa brgyad tshang bar bzlas na de nas klu rnams char gyi rgyun 'bebs par byed do //
analyzed: stong rtsa brgyad tshang bar bzlas na de nas klu rnams char gyi rgyun 'bebs par byed do //
translated: When the recitation of eight thousand is complete, then the nāgas will cause a rain to fall.

original: klu thams cad de'i dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: klu thams cad de'i dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: All nāgas will come under one’s control.

original: yungs kar la bzlas brjod byas te klu'i mtshe'u ru gtor na /
analyzed: yungs kar la bzlas brjod byas te klu'i mtshe'u ru gtor na /
translated: If one recites over mustard seeds and scatters them in a nāga lake,

original: char gyi rgyun 'bebs @460b par byed do //
analyzed: char gyi rgyun 'bebs @460b par byed do //
translated: it will cause a rain to fall.🔽If one recites over a peg made of cutch wood and plants it in a nāga’s abode,

original: seng ldeng gi phur pa la bzlas brjod byas te klu'i gnas su btsugs na rlung dang / ser ba thams cad bcings par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: seng ldeng gi phur pa la bzlas brjod byas te klu'i gnas su btsugs na rlung dang / ser ba thams cad bcings par 'gyur ro //
translated: all winds and hail will be bound.🔽If one recites over mustard seeds one hundred and eight times and scatters them on the head of a leading spirit,

original: yungs kar la brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas brjod byas te log 'dren gyi klad par btab na log 'dren thams cad bcings par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yungs kar la brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas brjod byas te log 'dren gyi klad par btab na log 'dren thams cad bcings par 'gyur ro //
translated: all leading spirits will be bound.

original: 'o mas bkrus na phyis sos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o mas bkrus na phyis sos par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one washes them with milk, they will be cured.

original: las gang dang / gang kho na bya ba'i las de dang / de dag 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: las gang dang / gang kho na bya ba'i las de dang / de dag 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Whatever work one does, that work will be accomplished.

original: gtsang mas gos gtsang ma bgo bar bya ste /
analyzed: gtsang mas gos gtsang ma bgo bar bya ste /
translated: One should be clean and wear clean clothes.

original: 'di ni rtsa ba'i rig sngags kyi cho ga'i tshul yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni rtsa ba'i rig sngags kyi cho ga'i tshul yin no //
translated: This is the method of the root vidyā mantra.

original: gnyis pa'o //// da ni snying po'i las rnams 'byung ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa'o //// da ni snying po'i las rnams 'byung ste /
translated: Now, the essence mantras will be taught.

original: bzlas brjod 'bum byas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bzlas brjod 'bum byas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one recites the essence mantra one hundred thousand times, one will see all the tathāgatas.

original: nyis 'bum byas na sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyis 'bum byas na sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one does two hundred thousand, one will see all the buddhafields.

original: sum 'bum byas na dkyil 'khor thams cad du zhugs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sum 'bum byas na dkyil 'khor thams cad du zhugs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one does three hundred thousand, one will enter all the maṇḍalas.

original: gsang sngags thams cad grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gsang sngags thams cad grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: All the mantras will be accomplished.

original: bzhi 'bum byas na rig 'dzin thams cad kyi 'khor los bsgyur bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bzhi 'bum byas na rig 'dzin thams cad kyi 'khor los bsgyur bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one does four hundred thousand, one will become a universal monarch of all the vidyādharas.

original: lnga 'bum byas na lha ma yin gyi sgo thams cad 'byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lnga 'bum byas na lha ma yin gyi sgo thams cad 'byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one does five hundred thousand, all the gates of the asuras will be opened.

original: klu'i gnas thams cad 'byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: klu'i gnas thams cad 'byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: All the abodes of the nāgas will be opened.

original: drug 'bum byas na gter thams cad 'bar bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: drug 'bum byas na gter thams cad 'bar bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one does six hundred thousand, all the treasures will blaze.

original: bzlas brjod bdun 'bum byas na tshe rabs thams cad dran par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bzlas brjod bdun 'bum byas na tshe rabs thams cad dran par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one does seven hundred thousand repetitions, one will remember all one’s lives.

original: bzlas brjod brgyad 'bum byas na rin chen phyag rgya'i ting nge 'dzin thob @461a *//🔽par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bzlas brjod brgyad 'bum byas na rin chen phyag rgya'i ting nge 'dzin thob @461a *//🔽par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one does eight hundred thousand repetitions, one will attain the ratnamudrā samādhi.

original: bzlas brjod dgu 'bum byas na byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi rnam par sprul pa'i byin gyis brlabs pa thams cad 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bzlas brjod dgu 'bum byas na byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi rnam par sprul pa'i byin gyis brlabs pa thams cad 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one recites it nine hundred thousand times, one will obtain all the blessings of the emanations of all bodhisattvas.

original: bzlas brjod sa ya byas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dbang bskur ba 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bzlas brjod sa ya byas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dbang bskur ba 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one recites it ten million times, one will obtain the empowerment of all tathāgatas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang phrad par 'gyur te; de la sogs pa gong nas gong du yon tan khyad par thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang phrad par 'gyur te; de la sogs pa gong nas gong du yon tan khyad par thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: One will meet all the tathāgatas, and so forth, and will obtain higher and higher special qualities.

original: mtshams med pa lnga byas pa'am /
analyzed: mtshams med pa lnga byas pa'am /
translated: Even those who have committed the five acts of immediate retribution,

original: 'phags pa la skur pa btab pa'am /
analyzed: 'phags pa la skur pa btab pa'am /
translated: those who have reviled the noble ones,

original: dam pa'i chos spangs pa'am /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos spangs pa'am /
translated: those who have abandoned the true Dharma,

original: mnar med par gzhol ba yang rung /
analyzed: mnar med par gzhol ba yang rung /
translated: and those who are headed for Avīci—

original: de dag thams cad kyis bzlas brjod 'bum byas na las kyi sgrib pa thams cad byang bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyis bzlas brjod 'bum byas na las kyi sgrib pa thams cad byang bar 'gyur /
translated: if all of them recite it one hundred thousand times, all their karmic obscurations will be purified.

original: phyir mi ldog par 'gyur /
analyzed: phyir mi ldog par 'gyur /
translated: They will become irreversible,

original: skye ba dran par 'gyur /
analyzed: skye ba dran par 'gyur /
translated: will remember their past lives,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis dgongs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis dgongs par 'gyur ro //
translated: and will be contemplated by all the tathāgatas.

original: mig rnam par dag pa dang / rna ba rnam par dag pa dang / sna rnam par dag pa dang / lce rnam par dag pa dang / dbang po yongs su dag pa thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: mig rnam par dag pa dang / rna ba rnam par dag pa dang / sna rnam par dag pa dang / lce rnam par dag pa dang / dbang po yongs su dag pa thob par 'gyur te /
translated: They will attain the purity of the eye faculty, the purity of the ear faculty, the purity of the nose faculty, the purity of the tongue faculty, and the purity of the body faculty.

original: de ltar gong nas gong du yon tan gyi khyad par dang / gong nas gong du lus rnam par dag pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar gong nas gong du yon tan gyi khyad par dang / gong nas gong du lus rnam par dag pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, they will attain the purity of the body faculty, which is superior to the previous ones.

original: gzhan yang / 'jig rten gyi dngos grub tu bya ba rnams 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang / 'jig rten gyi dngos grub tu bya ba rnams 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, they will accomplish the worldly siddhis.

original: de kho na grub pa bla na med pa ldong ros la bsgrub pa bshad de /
analyzed: de kho na grub pa bla na med pa ldong ros la bsgrub pa bshad de /
translated: The unsurpassed accomplishment of reality is explained as the accomplishment of the eye medicine.

original: @461b shin tu khrus byas pa /
analyzed: @461b shin tu khrus byas pa /
translated: One should bathe well,

original: gos gtsang ma bgos pa /
analyzed: gos gtsang ma bgos pa /
translated: put on clean clothes,

original: zas dkar gsum bza' bas ldong ros blangs te zangs kyi snod kyi nang du bzhag nas /
analyzed: zas dkar gsum bza' bas ldong ros blangs te zangs kyi snod kyi nang du bzhag nas /
translated: and take the eye medicine, placing it in a copper vessel.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar tshis bcu gsum nas tshes bco lnga'i bar du bzlas brjod 'bum byas na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar tshis bcu gsum nas tshes bco lnga'i bar du bzlas brjod 'bum byas na /
translated: In front of the Blessed Buddha, one should recite the mantra one hundred thousand times from the thirteenth to the fifteenth day.

original: de nas rnam pa gsum 'grub par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas rnam pa gsum 'grub par rig par bya ste /
translated: Then, one should know the accomplishment of the three types:

original: gal te nag por gyur na dpral ba la thig le bya'o //
analyzed: gal te nag por gyur na dpral ba la thig le bya'o //
translated: If it becomes black, one should apply a bindu to one’s forehead.

original: des ni mi snang ba 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: des ni mi snang ba 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: By this, invisibility will be accomplished.

original: lha ma yin gyi sgo thams cad du 'jug par 'gyur /
analyzed: lha ma yin gyi sgo thams cad du 'jug par 'gyur /
translated: One will be able to enter all the doors of the asuras.

original: gnas thams cad du 'jug par 'gyur /
analyzed: gnas thams cad du 'jug par 'gyur /
translated: One will be able to enter all the abodes.

original: gang 'dod pa byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang 'dod pa byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: One will be able to do whatever one wishes.

original: gal te dud pa byung na des mig bsku bar bya'o //
analyzed: gal te dud pa byung na des mig bsku bar bya'o //
translated: If smoke appears, one should anoint one’s eyes with it.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa'i gnas thams cad mthong bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa'i gnas thams cad mthong bar 'gyur /
translated: Then one will be able to see all the abodes of the bodhisattvas.

original: lag na rdo rje'i gnas thams cad mthong bar 'gyur /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la gsol ba gdab pa'i sngags so //
translated: The mantra for supplicating the bodhisattvas.

original: aom aa dhi sa ma ye badzra dha ra dha ra h'um/
analyzed: aom aa dhi sa ma ye badzra dha ra dha ra h'um/
translated: Oṃ adhiṣṭhane vajra dhara dhara huṃ.

original: lha dang / klu la sogs pa thams cad bod pa'i sngags so //
analyzed: lha dang / klu la sogs pa thams cad bod pa'i sngags so //
translated: The mantra for subduing all gods, nāgas, and so forth.

original: aom ma ni be ga ba ti h'um/
analyzed: aom ma ni be ga ba ti h'um/
translated: Oṃ maṇibhadravati huṃ.

original: rgyal po chen po bzhi bod pa'i sngags so //
analyzed: rgyal po chen po bzhi bod pa'i sngags so //
translated: The mantra for subduing the four great kings.

original: aom shu pa ma ni hu lu hu lu h'um/
analyzed: aom shu pa ma ni hu lu hu lu h'um/
translated: Oṃ śubhanī hulu hulu huṃ.

original: slob ma'i sngags so; ;aom sarba ta th'a ga ta hri da ya badzri ni dha ra dha ra h'um h'um/
analyzed: slob ma'i sngags so; ;aom sarba ta th'a ga ta hri da ya badzri ni dha ra dha ra h'um h'um/
translated: Oṃ sarva tathāgata hrīḥ vajrī ni dhāra dhāra hūṃ hūṃ.

original: 'jug pa'i sngags so //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i sngags so //
translated: The mantra for entering:

original: aom bi ra bi ra dze ga ga na b'a hi ni li hu lu hu lu h'um h'um h'um/
analyzed: aom bi ra bi ra dze ga ga na b'a hi ni li hu lu hu lu h'um h'um h'um/
translated: Oṃ virāje gagana vāhi nili hulu hulu hūṃ hūṃ hūṃ.

original: thams cad du mkhyen par bya ba'i sngags so //
analyzed: thams cad du mkhyen par bya ba'i sngags so //
translated: The mantra for knowing everything:

original: aom ma ni sumbha ni be ga ba ti /
analyzed: aom ma ni sumbha ni be ga ba ti /
translated: Oṃ maṇi sum bhe ni vega bhati.

original: bdag dang / che ge mo la srungs shig h'um/
analyzed: bdag dang / che ge mo la srungs shig h'um/
translated: Protect me and so-and-so, hūṃ.

original: bsrung ba'i sngags so //
analyzed: bsrung ba'i sngags so //
translated: The mantra for protection:

original: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta ku lo ti te sma ra na bi ga te dzv'a la dza la h'um sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta ku lo ti te sma ra na bi ga te dzv'a la dza la h'um sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ sarva tathāgata kuloti te smaraṇa vigata jvālā jala hūṃ svāhā.

original: slar gshegs su gsol ba'i sngags so //
analyzed: slar gshegs su gsol ba'i sngags so //
translated: The mantra for requesting departure:

original: thams cad la sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad la sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: It should be applied everywhere.

original: snying po 'di rnams kyi phan yon ni 'di dag thams cad yin te dpag tu @464b med do //
analyzed: snying po 'di rnams kyi phan yon ni 'di dag thams cad yin te dpag tu @464b med do //
translated: The benefits of these essence mantras are all of these, immeasurable.

original: thams cad du yang lan brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas brjod byas te /
analyzed: thams cad du yang lan brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas brjod byas te /
translated: In all cases, recite them one hundred and eight times.

original: de nas dgos pa brtsam par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas dgos pa brtsam par bya'o //
translated: Then, one should undertake what is to be done.

original: 'di bton pas ni thams cad 'grub //
analyzed: 'di bton pas ni thams cad 'grub //
translated: By reciting this, everything is accomplished.

original: 'dis ni 'gro ba'i sdig kun sel //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'gro ba'i sdig kun sel //
translated: It removes all the sins of beings.

original: sdig pa de ni zad byed cing //
analyzed: sdig pa de ni zad byed cing //
translated: It exhausts that sin,

original: sdug bsngal kun las rnam par grol //
analyzed: sdug bsngal kun las rnam par grol //
translated: and liberates from all suffering.

original: sangs rgyas byang chub sems dpa' dag /
analyzed: sangs rgyas byang chub sems dpa' dag /
translated: The buddhas and bodhisattvas

original: lung ston 'gyur te the tshom med //
analyzed: lung ston 'gyur te the tshom med //
translated: will prophesy without doubt.

original: gang gis snga mar sdig pa'i las //
analyzed: gang gis snga mar sdig pa'i las //
translated: Whoever has previously committed

original: mang po byas pa 'jig par 'gyur //
analyzed: mang po byas pa 'jig par 'gyur //
translated: many sinful actions will be destroyed.

original: rig pa bla med su 'dzin pa //
analyzed: rig pa bla med su 'dzin pa //
translated: Those who uphold the unsurpassed knowledge

original: de dag myur du sangs rgyas 'grub //
analyzed: de dag myur du sangs rgyas 'grub //
translated: will quickly attain buddhahood.

original: chos kyi 'khor lo bla med pa'i //
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo bla med pa'i //
translated: The unsurpassed wheel of Dharma

original: byang chub rtogs par sla ba dang // ji ltar gang+g'a'i bye snyed kyi //
analyzed: byang chub rtogs par sla ba dang // ji ltar gang+g'a'i bye snyed kyi //
translated: is easy to realize for awakening,

original: bsod nams dpag tu med 'thob bo //
analyzed: bsod nams dpag tu med 'thob bo //
translated: and one will obtain immeasurable merit🔽as numerous as the sands of the Ganges.

original: rig sngags rgyas par sgrub pa'i le'u ste /
analyzed: rig sngags rgyas par sgrub pa'i le'u ste /
translated: This is the chapter on accomplishing the extensive knowledge mantra,

original: cho ga gnyis pa'o ////
analyzed: cho ga gnyis pa'o ////
translated: the second ritual.

original: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga bshad par bya'o //
translated: Next, the maṇḍala ritual should be explained.

original: sngon du sa yongs su brtags nas phyi nas las brtsam par bya'o //
analyzed: sngon du sa yongs su brtags nas phyi nas las brtsam par bya'o //
translated: Having first examined the ground, one should commence the rite.

original: dri'i snod gtsang mar blugs pa'i tshon sna lnga'i phye mas dkyil 'khor sgo bzhi ba bri'o //
analyzed: dri'i snod gtsang mar blugs pa'i tshon sna lnga'i phye mas dkyil 'khor sgo bzhi ba bri'o //
translated: In a clean vessel, one should draw a four-doored maṇḍala with the powders of the five colors.

original: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su tsandan gyis byugs te gur gum gyis mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su tsandan gyis byugs te gur gum gyis mchod par bya'o //
translated: Then, having anointed the center of the maṇḍala with sandalwood, one should make an offering with saffron.

original: dbus kyi dkyil 'khor gyi tshad ni khru gnyis pa'o; ;phyi'i dkyil 'khor ni grva bzhi pa rva'i rang bzhin dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: dbus kyi dkyil 'khor gyi tshad ni khru gnyis pa'o; ;phyi'i dkyil 'khor ni grva bzhi pa rva'i rang bzhin dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The size of the central maṇḍala is two cubits. The outer maṇḍala has four corners and is endowed with a ledge.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi snying po'i dbus su rin po che sna bdun gyi gzhal med khang dang / sangs rgyas kyi @465a *//
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi snying po'i dbus su rin po che sna bdun gyi gzhal med khang dang / sangs rgyas kyi @465a *//
translated: In the center of the maṇḍala, one should draw a celestial mansion of the seven precious substances and a lotus seat of the Buddha

original: padma'i gdan bkra zhing tshon sna bdun dang ldan par bya'o //
analyzed: padma'i gdan bkra zhing tshon sna bdun dang ldan par bya'o //
translated: with a beautiful color and the seven precious substances.

original: padma'i snying po'i steng du gser gyi 'khor lo rtsibs stong pa mu khyud dang / lti ba dang ldan pa kun nas 'bar ba'i phreng ba can te /
analyzed: padma'i snying po'i steng du gser gyi 'khor lo rtsibs stong pa mu khyud dang / lti ba dang ldan pa kun nas 'bar ba'i phreng ba can te /
translated: In the center of the lotus, one should draw a golden wheel with a thousand spokes, a rim, and a hub, completely surrounded by a garland of flames.

original: yu ba ni bee d'urya'o //
analyzed: yu ba ni bee d'urya'o //
translated: The hub is made of beryl.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi snying po la kun nas kha khyer dang ldan par bya'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi snying po la kun nas kha khyer dang ldan par bya'o //
translated: The center of the maṇḍala should be surrounded by a ledge.

original: shar la sogs pa'i sgor ni khru'i tshad tsam gyi gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / tshon sna lnga'i rgya dag gi gos zung gis brgyan par bya'o //
analyzed: shar la sogs pa'i sgor ni khru'i tshad tsam gyi gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / tshon sna lnga'i rgya dag gi gos zung gis brgyan par bya'o //
translated: At the eastern and other doors, one should place parasols, banners, and flags, each one cubit in size, and adorn them with pairs of cloths of various colors.

original: g-yon du lag na rdo rje bsdigs pa'i gzugs can rnga yab dang / mtshon cha thogs shing bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: g-yon du lag na rdo rje bsdigs pa'i gzugs can rnga yab dang / mtshon cha thogs shing bzhugs pa'o //
translated: On the left side, one should place Vajrapāṇi, with a threatening form, holding a fly-whisk and a weapon.

original: g-yas su byang chub sems dpa' nor bu rdo rje rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa g-yas pa na nor bu dang / rnga yab thogs nas bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: g-yas su byang chub sems dpa' nor bu rdo rje rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa g-yas pa na nor bu dang / rnga yab thogs nas bzhugs pa'o //
translated: On the right side, one should place the bodhisattva Maṇivajra, adorned with all ornaments, holding a jewel and a fly-whisk with his right hand.

original: zur bzhir rgyal po chen po bzhi bri bar bya ste /
analyzed: zur bzhir rgyal po chen po bzhi bri bar bya ste /
translated: In the four corners, one should draw the four great kings,

original: go cha dang / tshem tshem bgos shing lag na mtshon cha thogs pa /
analyzed: go cha dang / tshem tshem bgos shing lag na mtshon cha thogs pa /
translated: wearing armor and helmets, holding weapons in their hands,

original: rgyan thams cad dang / ral pa'i cod pan dang ldan pa drag po'i gzugs can bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: rgyan thams cad dang / ral pa'i cod pan dang ldan pa drag po'i gzugs can bri bar bya'o //
translated: adorned with all ornaments, wearing crowns of hair, with fierce forms.

original: mtshams bzhir sbos chus gang ba'i gser gyi snod bzhi gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: mtshams bzhir sbos chus gang ba'i gser gyi snod bzhi gzhag par bya'o //
translated: In the four intermediate directions, one should place four golden vessels filled with scented water.

original: gal te gser gyi snod med na rdza'i bum pa tshad mi chung ba la gser g-yogs nas bya'o //
analyzed: gal te gser gyi snod med na rdza'i bum pa tshad mi chung ba la gser g-yogs nas bya'o //
translated: If there is no golden vessel, one should make it out of a large earthen pot covered with gold.

original: de lta bu'i snod mi 'dzag par 'o mas gang bar byas nas phyogs bzhir gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i snod mi 'dzag par 'o mas gang bar byas nas phyogs bzhir gzhag par bya'o //
translated: One should fill such a vessel with milk that does not drip, and place it in the four directions.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi g-yas logs su lha mo dpal @465b chen mo rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi g-yas logs su lha mo dpal @465b chen mo rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa'o //
translated: To the right of the maṇḍala, one should draw Śrī Mahādevī adorned with all ornaments.

original: g-yon du lha mo chen mo dung can ma bzhugs pa bri'o //
analyzed: g-yon du lha mo chen mo dung can ma bzhugs pa bri'o //
translated: To the left, one should draw Mahādevī Śaṅkhalā.

original: sgo'i dbus su lha mo chen mo rdo rje pho nya mo phyag brgyad pa lag na mtshon cha thogs pa /
analyzed: sgo'i dbus su lha mo chen mo rdo rje pho nya mo phyag brgyad pa lag na mtshon cha thogs pa /
translated: In the center of the gate, one should draw Mahādevī Vajra Dūtamā, with eight arms holding weapons,

original: rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan cing bzhugs pa bri'o //
analyzed: rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan cing bzhugs pa bri'o //
translated: adorned with all ornaments.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi snying po phyogs bzhir dar sngon po 'phyang ba dang / bcud sna tshogs dang / tshul sna tshogs gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi snying po phyogs bzhir dar sngon po 'phyang ba dang / bcud sna tshogs dang / tshul sna tshogs gzhag par bya'o //
translated: In the center of the maṇḍala, one should hang blue silk in the four directions, and place various essences and various methods.

original: bum pa gang ba bzhi dang / mar me sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / 'bras bu dang / me tog sna tshogs rnams gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: bum pa gang ba bzhi dang / mar me sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / 'bras bu dang / me tog sna tshogs rnams gzhag par bya'o //
translated: One should place four full vases, thirty-two lamps, fruits, and various flowers.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi ni gser las grub pa'i bum pa gzhag go /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi ni gser las grub pa'i bum pa gzhag go /
translated: For the Blessed Buddha, one should place a vase made of gold.

original: so sor du ru ka bsreg par bya'o //
analyzed: so sor du ru ka bsreg par bya'o //
translated: One should burn separately durvā grass.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi snying por dngul gyi rang bzhin gyi bum pa gzhag go /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi snying por dngul gyi rang bzhin gyi bum pa gzhag go /
translated: In the center of the maṇḍala, one should place a vase made of silver.

original: rdo rje 'dzin pa'i bdug spos so //
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin pa'i bdug spos so //
translated: For the Vajra-holder, incense.

original: nor bu 'dzin pa'i du ru ka dang / tsandan dang / mah'a r'a dza dang / kun du ru dang / k'a ka bi dza dang / spos dkar gyi bdug pa'o //
analyzed: nor bu 'dzin pa'i du ru ka dang / tsandan dang / mah'a r'a dza dang / kun du ru dang / k'a ka bi dza dang / spos dkar gyi bdug pa'o //
translated: For the Jewel-holder, durvā, sandalwood, mahārāja, tagara, kākabīja, and white sandalwood incense.

original: dpal lha mo'i tsandan no //🔽dung can ma'i gu gul lo //
analyzed: dpal lha mo'i tsandan no // dung can ma'i gu gul lo //
translated: For Śrī Devī, sandalwood.🔽For Śaṅkhinī, guggula.

original: pho nya mo'i sha la'i bdug spos te so sor bsreg par bya'o //
analyzed: pho nya mo'i sha la'i bdug spos te so sor bsreg par bya'o //
translated: For the Messenger, śāla incense—one should burn each separately.

original: gtor ma yang sbyin no //
analyzed: gtor ma yang sbyin no //
translated: One should also offer bali.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi snying po'i bya ba'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi snying po'i bya ba'o //
translated: This is the procedure in the center of the maṇḍala.

original: phyi rol gyi dkyil 'khor ni sgo bzhi rnam par 'byes shing cha mdzes pab kra shis kyi sgo bzhig nas ba bya'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi dkyil 'khor ni sgo bzhi rnam par 'byes shing cha mdzes pab kra shis kyi sgo bzhig nas ba bya'o //
translated: The outer maṇḍala is divided into four doors and is beautiful.

original: shar gyi sgor khyab 'jug 'khor dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: shar gyi sgor khyab 'jug 'khor dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Viṣṇu and his retinue are in the eastern door.

original: lhor dbang phyug chen po'o //
analyzed: lhor dbang phyug chen po'o //
translated: Maheśvara is in the south.

original: nub tu me tog so zhes bya ba'i gnod sbyin mo'o //🔽byang @466a *// du 'jigs byed ma zhes bya ba'i lha mo ngo tsha dang bcas pa bya ste /
analyzed: nub tu me tog so zhes bya ba'i gnod sbyin mo'o // byang @466a *// du 'jigs byed ma zhes bya ba'i lha mo ngo tsha dang bcas pa bya ste /
translated: In the west, the yakṣiṇī named Puṣpadantī.

original: na chung bdun dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: na chung bdun dang bcas pa'o //
translated: In the north, the goddess named Bhairavā should be drawn with her seven maidens.

original: de nas phur bu sum cu so gnyis gdab par byas la kha dog lnga'i skud pas phur bu bcing ngo //
analyzed: de nas phur bu sum cu so gnyis gdab par byas la kha dog lnga'i skud pas phur bu bcing ngo //
translated: Then, having driven in the thirty-two daggers, the daggers should be bound with five-colored thread.

original: zur bzhi mnyam par kha dog lnga'i ba dan gyis brgyan no //
analyzed: zur bzhi mnyam par kha dog lnga'i ba dan gyis brgyan no //
translated: The four corners should be adorned with five-colored banners.

original: me tog sna tshogs dgram pa dang / gtor ma dang / me tog sna tshogs rnams ma 'khrugs pa mnyam par bya'o //
analyzed: me tog sna tshogs dgram pa dang / gtor ma dang / me tog sna tshogs rnams ma 'khrugs pa mnyam par bya'o //
translated: Various flowers should be scattered, and various bali offerings should be arranged evenly.

original: bcud sna tshogs 'phrog pa'i snod bdun gzhag go /
analyzed: bcud sna tshogs 'phrog pa'i snod bdun gzhag go /
translated: Seven vessels for stealing various essences should be placed.

original: rdza'i snod sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / phye ma'i snod sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / pog phor sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / mar me brgya rtsa brgyad gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: rdza'i snod sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / phye ma'i snod sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / pog phor sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / mar me brgya rtsa brgyad gzhag par bya'o //
translated: and one hundred and eight lamps should be placed.🔽One hundred and eight garlands

original: phreng ba brgya rtsa brgyad dang / dri yis gang ba sna tshogs gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: phreng ba brgya rtsa brgyad dang / dri yis gang ba sna tshogs gzhag par bya'o //
translated: and various filled scent-containers should be placed.

original: bdug pa dang / kun du ru sna tshogs sreg go /
analyzed: bdug pa dang / kun du ru sna tshogs sreg go /
translated: Incense and various kinds of camphor should be burned.

original: de nas sgo nas 'jug pa la dri yis gang ba'i bum pa gnyis gzhag la /
analyzed: de nas sgo nas 'jug pa la dri yis gang ba'i bum pa gnyis gzhag la /
translated: Then, two scent-filled vases should be placed at the door.

original: ji ltar rnyed pa'i gtor ma byin nas ji lta ba bzhin du gzhug pa'i cho ga la spyad la /
analyzed: ji ltar rnyed pa'i gtor ma byin nas ji lta ba bzhin du gzhug pa'i cho ga la spyad la /
translated: Having given the bali offering as much as one has acquired, one should perform the rite of entering as before.

original: de nas aom ma ni bi pu la pra tishthi ta siddhe aa bhi shinytsa ya mam sarba ta th'a ga ta aa bhi she keerbha ra bha ra sam bha ra sam bha ra h'um/
analyzed: de nas aom ma ni bi pu la pra tishthi ta siddhe aa bhi shinytsa ya mam sarba ta th'a ga ta aa bhi she keerbha ra bha ra sam bha ra sam bha ra h'um/
translated: Then, (recite:) “Oṃ Maṇi Vipula Pratiṣṭhita Siddhī Abhiṣiñcāmi Maṃ Sarva Tathāgata Abhīṣekaira Bhārabhāra Saṃbhāra Saṃbhāra Hūṃ.

original: ji lta ba bzhin du sngags 'dis dbang bskur na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis dbugs 'byin pa dang / thams cad 'grub pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa yang mngon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du sngags 'dis dbang bskur na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis dbugs 'byin pa dang / thams cad 'grub pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa yang mngon du 'gyur ro //
translated: If one is empowered with this mantra just as it is, one will be consoled by all the tathāgatas, accomplish everything, and manifest nirvāṇa.

original: gang bsams pa'i don de de bzhin @466b du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang bsams pa'i don de de bzhin @466b du 'gyur ro //
translated: Whatever one wishes for will be just so.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rtog pa'i rjes su 'jug go /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rtog pa'i rjes su 'jug go /
translated: One will follow the imagination of all the tathāgatas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos zab mo la bzod pa 'thob cing rjes su rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos zab mo la bzod pa 'thob cing rjes su rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: One will attain and realize the profound Dharma of all the tathāgatas.

original: byang chub kyi snying por 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub kyi snying por 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One will go to the essence of awakening.

original: de lta bu la sogs pa yon tan gyi khyad par rnams 'thob ste /
analyzed: de lta bu la sogs pa yon tan gyi khyad par rnams 'thob ste /
translated: One will attain such special qualities.

original: ji srid bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi lam ma rdzogs kyi bar du phyir mi ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji srid bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi lam ma rdzogs kyi bar du phyir mi ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: One will be irreversible until the path of unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening is complete.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga sgrub pa'i le'u ste /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga sgrub pa'i le'u ste /
translated: This is the chapter on the accomplishment of the maṇḍala ritual.

original: cho ga gsum pa'o ////
analyzed: cho ga gsum pa'o ////
translated: This is the third ritual.

original: de nas phyag rgya'i mtshan nyid bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas phyag rgya'i mtshan nyid bshad par bya'o //
translated: Next, I will explain the characteristics of the mudrā.

original: snying po chen po bzhi'i phyag rgya la sbyar ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs spyi la sbyar ba dang / lag na rdo rje'i snying po bzhi'i phyag rgya btus pa rnams dang / dkyil 'khor gyi gdan gyi phyag rgya dang / phyag rgya gzhan yang brtsam par bya'o //

original: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gsang chen yin /
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gsang chen yin /
translated: This is the great secret of all the tathagatas.

original: lag na rdo rje /
analyzed: lag na rdo rje /

original: 'di ni 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa 'dul ba yin /
analyzed: 'di ni 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa 'dul ba yin /
translated: this is the subduing of the afflictions of all beings in Jambudvipa.

original: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sdig pa 'jigs pa yin /
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sdig pa 'jigs pa yin /
translated: This is the destruction of all evil of all the tathagatas.

original: 'di ni 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can thams cad kyi dmyal ba thams cad skems pa yin /
analyzed: 'di ni 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can thams cad kyi dmyal ba thams cad skems pa yin /

original: yi dvags kyi 'jig rten zlog pa yin /
analyzed: yi dvags kyi 'jig rten zlog pa yin /
translated: This is the reversal of the world of hungry ghosts.

original: dud 'gro'i skye gnas las thar bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: dud 'gro'i skye gnas las thar bar byed pa yin no //
translated: This is the liberation from the animal realm.

original: 'di ni 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can thams cad kyi skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa rnams skyems par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can thams cad kyi skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa rnams skyems par byed pa yin no //
translated: This is the quenching of the birth, aging, sickness, death, sorrow, lamentation, suffering, unhappiness, and strife of all sentient beings in Jambudvīpa.

original: lag na rdo rje /
analyzed: lag na rdo rje /
translated: Vajrapāṇi,

translated: the arising of this heap of merit is beyond the range of the divine eye,🔽and even the tathāgatas cannot describe it.

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs kyis kyang brjod kyis mi lang ste; yon tan gyi khyad par de ltar rgya che zhing de ltar zab pa /
translated: Such are the vast and profound special qualities,

analyzed: rab mchog gya nom pa la sogs pa de ltar gong nas gong du rnam par 'phrul pa chen po'i khyad par 'phags pa yin no //
translated: such are the superior and supreme great manifestations.

original: no; ;chen po rgyas pa'i gzhal med khang shin tu rab tu gnas pa gsang ba'i gzungs kyi cho ga zhib mo'i rgyal po 'di ni sems can skal ba chung du ba rnams kyi @472b lag tu 'ong bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: no; ;chen po rgyas pa'i gzhal med khang shin tu rab tu gnas pa gsang ba'i gzungs kyi cho ga zhib mo'i rgyal po 'di ni sems can skal ba chung du ba rnams kyi @472b lag tu 'ong bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: “Mahāvajra, this king of extensive dhāraṇī-sūtras, which is the most secret of the most secret, will not come into the hands of beings of little merit.

original: thos par mi 'gyur /🔽bsnyen bkur byed par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: thos par mi 'gyur / bsnyen bkur byed par mi 'gyur /
