analyzed: gang gis gang+g'a'i klung gi bye ma dang mnyam pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ma mthong ba de'i lag tu mchog tu gsang ba 'di 'ong ba'am / mnyan pa'am / bsnyen bkur byed pa'am /
translated: How could this most secret dhāraṇī come into the hands of those who have not seen tathāgatas equal to the number of grains of sand in the Ganges River?🔽How could it be heard, served,

original: 'dzin pa lta ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: 'dzin pa lta ga la 'gyur /
translated: or held?

original: lag na rdo rje /
analyzed: lag na rdo rje /
translated: Vajrapāṇi,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba 'di ni shin tu gting dpag dka' ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba 'di ni shin tu gting dpag dka' ste /
translated: this secret of the tathāgatas is extremely difficult to fathom.

original: lag na rdo rje /
analyzed: lag na rdo rje /
translated: Vajrapāṇi,

original: gang gis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das chu bo gang+g'a'i klung gi bye ma khrag khrig brgyad stong gi bye ma dang mnyam pa rnams la /
analyzed: gang gis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das chu bo gang+g'a'i klung gi bye ma khrag khrig brgyad stong gi bye ma dang mnyam pa rnams la /
translated: those who have not served buddhas equal to the number of grains of sand in eighty thousand Ganges Rivers,

original: bskal pa brgya stong du bde ba'i yo byad na bza' dang / bsod snyoms dang / gzims cha dang / bsnyun dpyad kyi rkyen sman gyi yo byad dang / bza' ba dang / bca' ba dang / zhal zas dang / btung ba dang / bcibs pa dang /
analyzed: bskal pa brgya stong du bde ba'i yo byad na bza' dang / bsod snyoms dang / gzims cha dang / bsnyun dpyad kyi rkyen sman gyi yo byad dang / bza' ba dang / bca' ba dang / zhal zas dang / btung ba dang / bcibs pa dang /
translated: For hundreds of thousands of eons, they offer to the tathagatas every day🔽robes, alms, bedding, and medicines for the sick,

original: pho brang rnams de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la nyi ma re re 'bul zhing /🔽de bzhin du me tog dang / bdug pa dang / dri dang / phreng ba dang / byug pa dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan gyis de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la mchod pa byed pa dang / gang gis stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams rin po che sna bdun gyis byur bur bkang ste /
analyzed: pho brang rnams de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la nyi ma re re 'bul zhing / de bzhin du me tog dang / bdug pa dang / dri dang / phreng ba dang / byug pa dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan gyis de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la mchod pa byed pa dang / gang gis stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams rin po che sna bdun gyis byur bur bkang ste /
translated: as well as food and drink, vehicles, and palaces.🔽In the same way, they make offerings to all the tathagatas with flowers, incense, perfume, garlands, ointments, parasols, banners, and flags.

original: nyi ma re re sangs rgyas thams cad la dbul ba ni @473a *//
analyzed: nyi ma re re sangs rgyas thams cad la dbul ba ni @473a *//
translated: And they fill the worlds of the great trichiliocosm with the seven kinds of precious substances and offer them to all the buddhas every day.

original: bsod nams kyi phung po chen po bskyed pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: bsod nams kyi phung po chen po bskyed pa ma yin gyi /
translated: This does not generate a great heap of merit.

original: lag na rdo rje /
analyzed: lag na rdo rje /
translated: Vajrapāṇi,

original: gang gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba 'di lan gcig bzlas brjod byas na bsod nams kyi phung po ches mang po dang ldan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba 'di lan gcig bzlas brjod byas na bsod nams kyi phung po ches mang po dang ldan par 'gyur te /
translated: if someone recites this secret of the Tathāgatas just once, they will come to possess a great heap of merit.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis kyang brjod kyis mi lang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis kyang brjod kyis mi lang ngo //
translated: Even all the Tathāgatas could not express it.

original: gang gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba'i gzungs kyi rgyal po 'di lan gcig dran par gyur na ni de gong du bshang pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par yongs su bsgrags pas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mchod par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba'i gzungs kyi rgyal po 'di lan gcig dran par gyur na ni de gong du bshang pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par yongs su bsgrags pas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mchod par 'gyur /
translated: If someone were to recall this king of dhāraṇī secrets of the Tathāgatas just once, they would come to possess the special qualities of merit that have been proclaimed above. They would make offerings to all the Tathāgatas.

original: mkho ba'i yo byad khyad par du 'phags pa ji lta ba thams cad kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba rnams la de ltar nyin gcig bzhin mchod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mkho ba'i yo byad khyad par du 'phags pa ji lta ba thams cad kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba rnams la de ltar nyin gcig bzhin mchod par 'gyur ro //
translated: They would make offerings to the secrets of the Tathāgatas every day with all the special requisites.

original: de nas 'khor 'dus pa de dag thams cad dang / lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / srin po dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha'i lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / mi dang / mi ma yin pa thams cad kyis /
analyzed: de nas 'khor 'dus pa de dag thams cad dang / lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / srin po dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha'i lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / mi dang / mi ma yin pa thams cad kyis /
translated: Then all those assembled in the retinue, and the gods, nāgas, yakṣas, rākṣasas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, mahoragas, humans, and non-humans,

original: aa la la zhes ca co dang / ga zha'i sgra cher bton nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la gtugs te bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: aa la la zhes ca co dang / ga zha'i sgra cher bton nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la gtugs te bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: with cries of A la la! and shouts of joy, bowed down at the feet of the Blessed One and said to the Blessed One:

original: kye ma'o // sangs rgyas 'byung ba dang mtshungs par mchog tu rnyed par dka' ba gsang ba dam pa'i snying po 'dzam bu'i gling du bzhag @473b lags so //
analyzed: kye ma'o // sangs rgyas 'byung ba dang mtshungs par mchog tu rnyed par dka' ba gsang ba dam pa'i snying po 'dzam bu'i gling du bzhag @473b lags so //
translated: Oh! The essence of the sublime secret, which is as difficult to obtain as the appearance of a buddha, has been placed in the world!

original: de nas phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis sh'akya thub ba la legs so zhes bya ba byin nas rang rang gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnams su gshegs so //
analyzed: de nas phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis sh'akya thub ba la legs so zhes bya ba byin nas rang rang gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnams su gshegs so //
translated: Then all the tathāgatas of the ten directions gave their approval to Śākyamuni and departed to their own buddha-fields.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa sh'akya thub pa yang rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul chen pos mi mjed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams su gshegs so //🔽'phags pa nor bu chen po rgyas pa'i gzhal med khang shin tu rab tu gnas pa gsang ba dam pa'i gsang ba'i cho ga zhib mo'i rgyal po'i le'u ste /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa sh'akya thub pa yang rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul chen pos mi mjed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams su gshegs so // 'phags pa nor bu chen po rgyas pa'i gzhal med khang shin tu rab tu gnas pa gsang ba dam pa'i gsang ba'i cho ga zhib mo'i rgyal po'i le'u ste /
translated: Then the Blessed One, the Tathāgata Śākyamuni, also went to the Sahā world system through a great miraculous display.

original: bdun pa rdzogs so ////🔽rgya gar gyi mkhan po bidy'a ka ra pra bha dang / lotstsha ba bande dpal gyi lhun pos bsgyur cing /
analyzed: bdun pa rdzogs so //// rgya gar gyi mkhan po bidy'a ka ra pra bha dang / lotstsha ba bande dpal gyi lhun pos bsgyur cing /
translated: This concludes the chapter on the palace of the vast great jewel, the king of the secret, sublime, secret, detailed rites, the seventh.🔽Translated by the Indian preceptor Viśvamitra and the Tibetan translator Bandé Palgyi Lhünpo.

original: slad nas rgya gar gyi mkhan po bidy'a ka ra pra bha dang / zhus chen gyi lotstsha ba bende dpal brtsegs kyis zhus te gtan la phab pa //
analyzed: slad nas rgya gar gyi mkhan po bidy'a ka ra pra bha dang / zhus chen gyi lotstsha ba bende dpal brtsegs kyis zhus te gtan la phab pa //
